text: VIII The wretchedness of a scheme to Box Hill was in Emma 's thoughts all the evening .
text_tokenized: VIII The wretchedness of a scheme to Box Hill was in Emma 's thoughts all the evening .

text: How it might be considered by the rest of the party , she could not tell .
text_tokenized: How it might be considered by the rest of the party , she could not tell .

text: They , in their different homes , and their different ways , might be looking back on it with pleasure ; but in her view it was a morning more completely misspent , more totally bare of rational satisfaction at the time , and more to be abhorred in recollection , than any she had ever passed

text: A whole evening of back - gammon with her father , was felicity to it .
text_tokenized: A whole evening of back - gammon with her father , was felicity to it .

text: _ There _ , indeed , lay real pleasure , for there she was giving up the sweetest hours of the twenty - four to his comfort ; and feeling that , unmerited as might be the degree of his fond affection and confiding esteem , she could not , in her general conduct , be open to any severe reproach .
text_tokenized: _ There _ , indeed , lay real pleasure , for there she was giving up the sweetest hours of the twenty - four to his comfort ; and feeling that , unmerited as might be the degree of his fond affection and confiding esteem , she could not , in her general conduct , be open to any severe reproach .

text: As a daughter , she hoped she was not without a heart .
text_tokenized: As a daughter , she hoped she was not without a heart .

text: She hoped no one could have said to her , " How could you be so unfeeling to your father?-- I must , I will tell you truths while I can . "
text_tokenized: She hoped no one could have said to her , " How could you be so unfeeling to your father?-- I must , I will tell you truths while I can . "

text: Miss Bates should never again -- no , never !
text_tokenized: Miss Bates should never again -- no , never !

text: If attention , in future , could do away the past , she might hope to be forgiven . She had been often remiss , her conscience told her so ; remiss , perhaps , more in thought than fact ; scornful , ungracious .
text_tokenized: If attention , in future , could do away the past , she might hope to be forgiven . She had been often remiss , her conscience told her so ; remiss , perhaps , more in thought than fact ; scornful , ungracious .

text: But it should be so no more .
text_tokenized: But it should be so no more .

text: In the warmth of true contrition , she would call upon her the very next morning , and it should be the beginning , on her side , of a regular , equal , kindly intercourse .
text_tokenized: In the warmth of true contrition , she would call upon her the very next morning , and it should be the beginning , on her side , of a regular , equal , kindly intercourse .

text: She was just as determined when the morrow came , and went early , that nothing might prevent her . It was not unlikely , she thought , that she might see Mr. Knightley in her way ; or , perhaps , he might come in while she were paying her visit .
text_tokenized: She was just as determined when the morrow came , and went early , that nothing might prevent her . It was not unlikely , she thought , that she might see Mr. Knightley in her way ; or , perhaps , he might come in while she were paying her visit .

text: She had no objection .
text_tokenized: She had no objection .

text: She would not be ashamed of the appearance of the penitence , so justly and truly hers .
text_tokenized: She would not be ashamed of the appearance of the penitence , so justly and truly hers .

text: Her eyes were towards Donwell as she walked , but she saw him not .
text_tokenized: Her eyes were towards Donwell as she walked , but she saw him not .

text_tokenized: " The ladies were all at home . "

text: She had never rejoiced at the sound before , nor ever before entered the passage , nor walked up the stairs , with any wish of giving pleasure , but in conferring obligation , or of deriving it , except in subsequent ridicule .

text: She heard Miss Bates 's voice , something was to be done in a hurry ; the maid looked frightened and awkward ; hoped she would be pleased to wait a moment , and then ushered her in too soon . The aunt and niece seemed both escaping into the adjoining room . Jane

text: had a distinct glimpse of , looking extremely ill ; and , before the door had shut them out , she heard Miss Bates saying , " Well , my dear , I shall _ say _ you are laid down upon the bed , and I am sure you are ill enough . " Poor old Mrs. Bates , civil and humble as usual , looked as if she did not quite understand what was going on . " I am afraid Jane is not very well , " said she , " but I do not know ; they _ tell _ me she is well .

text: But Miss Bates soon came--"Very happy and obliged"--but Emma 's conscience told her that there was not the same cheerful volubility as before -- less ease of look and manner . A very friendly inquiry after Miss Fairfax , she hoped , might lead the way to a return of old feelings .

text: The touch seemed immediate .
text_tokenized: The touch seemed immediate .

text: " Ah ! Miss Woodhouse , how kind you are!--I suppose you have heard-- and are come to give us joy .
text_tokenized: " Ah ! Miss Woodhouse , how kind you are!--I suppose you have heard-- and are come to give us joy .

text: This does not seem much like joy , indeed , in me--(twinkling away a tear or two)--but it will be very trying for us to part with her , after having had her so long , and she has a dreadful headache just now , writing all the morning:-- such long letters , you know , to be written to Colonel Campbell , and Mrs. Dixon . ` My dear , ' said I , ` you will blind yourself'-- for tears were in her eyes perpetually .
text_tokenized: This does not seem much like joy , indeed , in me--(twinkling away a tear or two)--but it will be very trying for us to part with her , after having had her so long , and she has a dreadful headache just now , writing all the morning:-- such long letters , you know , to be written to Colonel Campbell , and Mrs. Dixon . ` My dear , ' said I , ` you will blind yourself'-- for tears were in her eyes perpetually .

text: One can not wonder , one can not wonder .
text_tokenized: One can not wonder , one can not wonder .

text: It is a great change ; and though she is amazingly fortunate -- such a situation , I suppose , as no young woman before ever met with on first going out -- do not think us ungrateful , Miss Woodhouse , for such surprising good fortune--(again dispersing her tears)--but , poor dear soul ! if you were to see what a headache she has .
text_tokenized: It is a great change ; and though she is amazingly fortunate -- such a situation , I suppose , as no young woman before ever met with on first going out -- do not think us ungrateful , Miss Woodhouse , for such surprising good fortune--(again dispersing her tears)--but , poor dear soul ! if you were to see what a headache she has .

text: When one is in great pain , you know one can not feel any blessing quite as it may deserve .
text_tokenized: When one is in great pain , you know one can not feel any blessing quite as it may deserve .

text: She is as low as possible .
text_tokenized: She is as low as possible .

text: To look at her , nobody would think how delighted and happy she is to have secured such a situation . You will excuse her not coming to you -- she is not able -- she is gone into her own room-- I want her to lie down upon the bed .
text_tokenized: To look at her , nobody would think how delighted and happy she is to have secured such a situation . You will excuse her not coming to you -- she is not able -- she is gone into her own room-- I want her to lie down upon the bed .

text: ` My dear , ' said I , ` I shall say you are laid down upon the bed : ' but , however , she is not ; she is walking about the room .
text_tokenized: ` My dear , ' said I , ` I shall say you are laid down upon the bed : ' but , however , she is not ; she is walking about the room .

text: But , now that she has written her letters , she says she shall soon be well .
text_tokenized: But , now that she has written her letters , she says she shall soon be well .

text: She will be extremely sorry to miss seeing you , Miss Woodhouse , but your kindness will excuse her .
text_tokenized: She will be extremely sorry to miss seeing you , Miss Woodhouse , but your kindness will excuse her .

text: Her heart had been long growing kinder towards Jane ; and this picture of her present sufferings acted as a cure of every former ungenerous suspicion , and left her nothing but pity ; and the remembrance of the less just and less gentle sensations of the past , obliged her to admit that Jane might very naturally resolve on seeing Mrs. Cole or any other steady friend , when she might not bear to see herself .

text: She spoke as she felt , with earnest regret and solicitude -- sincerely wishing that the circumstances which she collected from Miss Bates to be now actually determined on , might be as much for Miss Fairfax 's advantage and comfort as possible . " It must be a severe trial to them all . She had understood it was to be delayed till Colonel Campbell 's return . " " So very kind ! " replied Miss Bates .
text_tokenized: She spoke as she felt , with earnest regret and solicitude -- sincerely wishing that the circumstances which she collected from Miss Bates to be now actually determined on , might be as much for Miss Fairfax 's advantage and comfort as possible . " It must be a severe trial to them all . She had understood it was to be delayed till Colonel Campbell 's return . " " So very kind ! " replied Miss Bates .

text: " But you are always kind . " There was no bearing such an " always ; " and to break through her dreadful gratitude , Emma made the direct inquiry of-- " Where -- may I ask?--is Miss Fairfax going ? " " To a Mrs. Smallridge -- charming woman -- most superior -- to have the charge of her three little girls -- delightful children . Impossible that any situation could be more replete with comfort ; if we except , perhaps , Mrs. Suckling 's own family , and Mrs. Bragge 's ; but Mrs. Smallridge is intimate with both , and in the very same neighbourhood:--lives only four miles from Maple Grove .

text: " Mrs. Elton , I suppose , has been the person to whom Miss Fairfax owes-- " " Yes , our good Mrs. Elton .
text_tokenized: " Mrs. Elton , I suppose , has been the person to whom Miss Fairfax owes-- " " Yes , our good Mrs. Elton .

text: The most indefatigable , true friend .
text_tokenized: The most indefatigable , true friend .

text: She would not take a denial .
text_tokenized: She would not take a denial .

text: She would not let Jane say , ` No ; ' for when Jane first heard of it , ( it was the day before yesterday , the very morning we were at Donwell , ) when Jane first heard of it , she was quite decided against accepting the offer , and for the reasons you mention ; exactly as you say , she had made up her mind to close with nothing till Colonel Campbell 's return , and nothing should induce her to enter into any engagement at present -- and so she told Mrs. Elton over and over again -- and I am sure I had no more idea that she would change her mind!--but that good Mrs. Elton , whose judgment never fails her , saw farther than I did .
text_tokenized: She would not let Jane say , ` No ; ' for when Jane first heard of it , ( it was the day before yesterday , the very morning we were at Donwell , ) when Jane first heard of it , she was quite decided against accepting the offer , and for the reasons you mention ; exactly as you say , she had made up her mind to close with nothing till Colonel Campbell 's return , and nothing should induce her to enter into any engagement at present -- and so she told Mrs. Elton over and over again -- and I am sure I had no more idea that she would change her mind!--but that good Mrs. Elton , whose judgment never fails her , saw farther than I did .

text_tokenized: Quite a surprize to me !

text: I had not the least idea!--Jane took Mrs. Elton aside , and told her at once , that upon thinking over the advantages of Mrs. Smallridge 's situation , she had come to the resolution of accepting it.--I did not know a word of it till it was all settled . " "

text: " No , not Mr. Knightley ; he declined it from the first ; and though I thought he would come , because Mrs. Elton declared she would not let him off , he did not;--but my mother , and Jane , and I , were all there , and a very agreeable evening we had .

text: Such kind friends , you know , Miss Woodhouse , one must always find agreeable , though every body seemed rather fagged after the morning 's party .
text_tokenized: Such kind friends , you know , Miss Woodhouse , one must always find agreeable , though every body seemed rather fagged after the morning 's party .

text: Even pleasure , you know , is fatiguing -- and I can not say that any of them seemed very much to have enjoyed it .
text_tokenized: Even pleasure , you know , is fatiguing -- and I can not say that any of them seemed very much to have enjoyed it .

text: However , _ I _ shall always think it a very pleasant party , and feel extremely obliged to the kind friends who included me in it .
text_tokenized: However , _ I _ shall always think it a very pleasant party , and feel extremely obliged to the kind friends who included me in it .

text: " " Miss Fairfax , I suppose , though you were not aware of it , had been making up her mind the whole day ? " " I dare say she had .

text: " " Whenever the time may come , it must be unwelcome to her and all her friends -- but I hope her engagement will have every alleviation that is possible -- I mean , as to the character and manners of the family . "
text_tokenized: " " Whenever the time may come , it must be unwelcome to her and all her friends -- but I hope her engagement will have every alleviation that is possible -- I mean , as to the character and manners of the family . "

text: " Thank you , dear Miss Woodhouse .
text_tokenized: " Thank you , dear Miss Woodhouse .

text: Yes , indeed , there is every thing in the world that can make her happy in it .

text: " You are so noble in your ideas ! "

text: " And when is Miss Fairfax to leave you ?
text_tokenized: " And when is Miss Fairfax to leave you ?

text: " Very soon , very soon , indeed ; that 's the worst of it . Within a fortnight . Mrs. Smallridge is in a great hurry .
text_tokenized: " Very soon , very soon , indeed ; that 's the worst of it . Within a fortnight . Mrs. Smallridge is in a great hurry .

text: My poor mother does not know how to bear it .

text: So then , I try to put it out of her thoughts , and say , Come ma'am , do not let us think about it any more .

text: " Her friends must all be sorry to lose her ; and will not Colonel and Mrs. Campbell be sorry to find that she has engaged herself before their return ? "
text_tokenized: " Her friends must all be sorry to lose her ; and will not Colonel and Mrs. Campbell be sorry to find that she has engaged herself before their return ? "

text: " Yes ; Jane says she is sure they will ; but yet , this is such a situation as she can not feel herself justified in declining . I was so astonished when she first told me what she had been saying to Mrs. Elton , and when Mrs. Elton at the same moment came congratulating me upon it !
text_tokenized: " Yes ; Jane says she is sure they will ; but yet , this is such a situation as she can not feel herself justified in declining . I was so astonished when she first told me what she had been saying to Mrs. Elton , and when Mrs. Elton at the same moment came congratulating me upon it !

text: It was before tea -- stay -- no , it could not be before tea , because we were just going to cards -- and yet it was before tea , because I remember thinking -- Oh ! no , now I recollect , now I have it ; something happened before tea , but not that .
text_tokenized: It was before tea -- stay -- no , it could not be before tea , because we were just going to cards -- and yet it was before tea , because I remember thinking -- Oh ! no , now I recollect , now I have it ; something happened before tea , but not that .

text: Mr. Elton was called out of the room before tea , old John Abdy 's son wanted to speak with him .
text_tokenized: Mr. Elton was called out of the room before tea , old John Abdy 's son wanted to speak with him .

text: Poor old John , I have a great regard for him ; he was clerk to my poor father twenty - seven years ; and now , poor old man , he is bed - ridden , and very poorly with the rheumatic gout in his joints-- I must go and see him to - day ; and so will Jane , I am sure ,
text_tokenized: Poor old John , I have a great regard for him ; he was clerk to my poor father twenty - seven years ; and now , poor old man , he is bed - ridden , and very poorly with the rheumatic gout in his joints-- I must go and see him to - day ; and so will Jane , I am sure ,

text: if she gets out at all .
text_tokenized: if she gets out at all .

text: And poor John 's son came to talk to Mr. Elton about relief from the parish ; he is very well to do himself , you know , being head man at the Crown , ostler , and every thing of that sort , but still he can not keep his father without some help ; and so , when Mr. Elton came back , he told us what John ostler had been telling him , and then it came out about the chaise having been sent to Randalls to take Mr. Frank Churchill to Richmond .
text_tokenized: And poor John 's son came to talk to Mr. Elton about relief from the parish ; he is very well to do himself , you know , being head man at the Crown , ostler , and every thing of that sort , but still he can not keep his father without some help ; and so , when Mr. Elton came back , he told us what John ostler had been telling him , and then it came out about the chaise having been sent to Randalls to take Mr. Frank Churchill to Richmond .

text: That was what happened before tea .
text_tokenized: That was what happened before tea .

text: It was after tea that Jane spoke to Mrs. Elton . " Miss Bates would hardly give Emma time to say how perfectly new this circumstance was to her ; but as without supposing it possible that she could be ignorant of any of the particulars of Mr. Frank Churchill 's going , she proceeded to give them all , it was of no consequence .
text_tokenized: It was after tea that Jane spoke to Mrs. Elton . " Miss Bates would hardly give Emma time to say how perfectly new this circumstance was to her ; but as without supposing it possible that she could be ignorant of any of the particulars of Mr. Frank Churchill 's going , she proceeded to give them all , it was of no consequence .

text: What Mr. Elton had learned from the ostler on the subject , being the accumulation of the ostler 's own knowledge , and the knowledge of the servants at Randalls , was , that a messenger had come over from Richmond soon after the return of the party from Box Hill-- which messenger , however , had been no more than was expected ; and that Mr. Churchill had sent his nephew a few lines , containing , upon the whole , a tolerable account of Mrs. Churchill , and only wishing him not to delay coming back beyond the next morning early ; but that Mr. Frank Churchill having resolved to go home directly , without waiting at all , and his horse seeming to have got a cold , Tom had been sent off immediately for the Crown chaise , and the ostler had stood out and seen it pass by , the boy going a good pace , and driving very steady .
text_tokenized: What Mr. Elton had learned from the ostler on the subject , being the accumulation of the ostler 's own knowledge , and the knowledge of the servants at Randalls , was , that a messenger had come over from Richmond soon after the return of the party from Box Hill-- which messenger , however , had been no more than was expected ; and that Mr. Churchill had sent his nephew a few lines , containing , upon the whole , a tolerable account of Mrs. Churchill , and only wishing him not to delay coming back beyond the next morning early ; but that Mr. Frank Churchill having resolved to go home directly , without waiting at all , and his horse seeming to have got a cold , Tom had been sent off immediately for the Crown chaise , and the ostler had stood out and seen it pass by , the boy going a good pace , and driving very steady .

text: There was nothing in all this either to astonish or interest , and it caught Emma 's attention only as it united with the subject which already engaged her mind .
text_tokenized: There was nothing in all this either to astonish or interest , and it caught Emma 's attention only as it united with the subject which already engaged her mind .

text: The contrast between Mrs. Churchill 's importance in the world , and Jane Fairfax 's , struck her ; one was every thing , the other nothing -- and she sat musing on the difference of woman 's destiny , and quite unconscious on what her eyes were fixed , till roused by Miss Bates 's saying , " Aye , I see what you are thinking of , the pianoforte .
text_tokenized: The contrast between Mrs. Churchill 's importance in the world , and Jane Fairfax 's , struck her ; one was every thing , the other nothing -- and she sat musing on the difference of woman 's destiny , and quite unconscious on what her eyes were fixed , till roused by Miss Bates 's saying , " Aye , I see what you are thinking of , the pianoforte .

text: What is to become of that?--Very true .
text_tokenized: What is to become of that?--Very true .

text: Poor dear Jane was talking of it just now.-- ` You must go , ' said she .
text_tokenized: Poor dear Jane was talking of it just now.-- ` You must go , ' said she .

text: ` You and I must part .
text_tokenized: ` You and I must part .

text: You will have no business here.--Let it stay , however , ' said she ; ` give it houseroom till Colonel Campbell comes back .
text_tokenized: You will have no business here.--Let it stay , however , ' said she ; ` give it houseroom till Colonel Campbell comes back .

text: I shall talk about it to him ; he will settle for me ; he will help me out of all my difficulties . '-- And to this day , I do believe , she knows not whether it was his present or his daughter 's . " Now Emma was obliged to think of the pianoforte ; and the remembrance of all her former fanciful and unfair conjectures was so little pleasing , that she soon allowed herself to believe her visit had been long enough ; and , with a repetition of every thing that she could venture to say of the good wishes which she really felt , took leave .
